observation_1: Maya made cookies for her students.
observation_2: Her students loved the chocolate chip cookies.
hypothesis_1: Maya made sure to add extra chocolate chips.
hypothesis_2: Maya forgot the cookies in the oven and they burned.

observation_1: Maya tanned in near the beach all afternoon.
observation_2: The next day, Maya had a painful sunburn.
hypothesis_1: Maya made sure to apply extra sunscreen.
hypothesis_2: Maya forgot her sunscreen at home.

observation_2: Phoenix's roommate was upset and confronted him.
hypothesis_2: Phoenix left a mess in the kitchen.

observation_2: He discovered he loves spicy tuna sushi.
hypothesis_1: Aaron's roommate treated him for a birthday dinner.
hypothesis_2: Aaron's Japanese friend Kenji made him a sushi dinner.

observation_1: Diya was nervous for her final chemistry exam.
observation_2: Diya scored highest in her class for the exam.
hypothesis_1: Diya studied all week for the exam and reviewed all the lectures.
hypothesis_2: Diya celebrated graduation the night of the exam.

observation_2: Maya ended up in the emergency room.
hypothesis_1: Maya was biking extra fast to get to work on time.
hypothesis_2: A car hit Maya while she was biking.

observation_1: Ronan hated his service job but loved music.
observation_2: Now, Ronan makes music and earns lots of money.
hypothesis_1: Ronan studied and practiced singing after he quit his job.
hypothesis_2: Ronan went to college and studied accounting.

observation_1: Jonathan lifted weights consistently for a year.
hypothesis_1: Jonathan's diet consisted of solely bread, chocolate, and cheese.
hypothesis_2: Jonathan's diet consisted of solely rice, chicken, and broccoli.

observation_1: Nisha used to hate the taste of chicken.
observation_2: Nisha now frequently enjoys the taste of chicken.
hypothesis_1: Maya prepared Nisha a tasty fried chicken dish.
hypothesis_2: The last time Nisha ate fried chicken, she got food poisoning.

observation_1: Jacob was the oldest child in his family.
observation_2: His younger sibling was mad at him.
